title: Fresh fears Simmons won’t play this season
text:
Boogies' below the belt blow 0:27 Ben Simmons looking more and more unlikely to make his NBA debut this season February 14, 2017 11:26am   FOX SPORTS RUMOURS that Ben Simmons would skip the entire NBA season were quickly shut down when they first arose, but now that’s looking like the likely scenario for the No. 1 overall pick. 
Simmons’ recovery from a fractured foot appear to be on schedule, but Brett Brown has put forward an ultimatum for his new Australian point forward. 
The Philadelphia 76ers head coach told reporters that he wanted Simmons to take part in more than five 5-on-5 games in practice before he steps foot on an actual NBA court. When asked whether Simmons is close to starting those types of activities, Brown was blunt with his assessment. 
“I don’t think so,” Brown said. 
“I feel like he’s moving forward, but to say that we believe he’s going to be ready for 5-on-5 during the All-Star break would be misleading. I don’t see that. Ben Simmons’ debut is looking more and more unlikely. Source: Getty Images 
“He is moving forward but it’s at a very slow pace, our pace. I think when we all get back and he’s around the team again, because it’s not an ideal situation to manufacture 5-on-5 during a break, then we can better craft and construct to allow the return to play to be more responsible.” 
As noted by Philly.com’s Bob Cooney , the 76ers have just 28 games remaining, which includes a flurry of games away from home. Simmons hasn’t been with the team on road trips, lately, so it’s tough to imagine he’ll be able to get in the required practices while the team is travelling so much. 
While the 76ers are keen to develop their two young stars, Simmons and Joel Embiid, the health of the athletes would be paramount, along with the potential of earning a high draft pick in a draft stacked with quality point guards; a team need. 
Reached for comment, Simmons’ management told foxpsorts.com.au that no schedule has been set for his NBA debut. View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
